Text:
Direct confrontation with the Church's inquisitors,
the Templars, brought about an unexpected and vital
change in how we, the Shadow Garden, operate.

...Victoria, the sacred prophetess of the Holy State
of Orum, leads the Templars.
Victoria, in fact, knows Zeta personally.

Due to their face-to-face confrontation in the recent
battle, the Templars are now aware that Zeta is a
member of the Garden.

Despite their differences in handling the possessed,
the Cult and the Templars share a mutual interest in
the fact that the Garden's presence is a hindrance to
them both.

If the Templars move to hunt down the Garden, they
will inevitably trace Zeta's footsteps,

which raises the possibility that they may share
intel about Zeta with the Cult of Diablos.

...However, we at the Garden cannot afford to halt
our intel-gathering activities led by Zeta.

Thus, at Zeta's own request, we will place a
significant distance between her future intel
activities and the Garden.

I guess I won't be seeing as much of this
historic city as I'd like to...
Zeta!
Lady Alpha? I said you didn't need to see me off.

Or perhaps you're here to add another mission for me
to complete?
...Zeta, are you sure you want to do this?

It's not about what I want. I only have myself to
blame for this situation.

You're the leader of the Garden, Lady Alpha.
You shouldn't let your personal feelings cloud
your judgment...correct?
Well...you're right, but—

Besides, it's not like I'm never returning to
Alexandria.

I'll just be returning irregularly and ceasing my
regular reports. I'll lurk in the shadows and
contact you only when required.

It'll likely make things slightly more inconvenient
for you, but...it is what it is.

Now that the enemy leader knows my face, we must
guard the Garden's secrets more carefully.
Zeta—

And, who knows? I might obtain vital intel and
return before you know it, right?
...I do hope that's the case.
Hey, this isn't the time for jokes, Lady Alpha.
Otherwise, it sounds like...you're welcoming trouble!

I don't care if it sounds that way so long as you
come home.
Err...
Well, it might be easier if you considered...
...no news from me as good news.

I know. But you can return whether or not
there's a need to.

The ancient city of Alexandria is our home...
which means...it's your home.

Well, I'll return if necessary and if I can confirm
it's safe.
